means: 离开
放弃，抛弃
停止，中断
偿清
停止
放弃斗争
辞职
自由的
摆脱了责任或义务的
quantum interference transistor 量子干涉晶体管
[人名] 奎特

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"停止"之意。
means: cease ： 指逐渐、徐徐中止某种状态的存在。书面用词。
pause ： 指暂时的、瞬间的停顿，隐含有再进行之意。
stop ： 指动作、运行、进展等被停下来，含突然、断然的意味。
halt ： 侧重突然地、决定性地终止、停止某一活动。
quit ： 指最终彻底停止某事，有时暗示遭到失败或面临挫折。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"离开某处"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: depart, leave, go, start, quit, set out
means: depart ： 较正式用词，指经过周密考虑或郑重地离开，强调离开的起点。
leave ： 侧重出发地而不是目的地。
go ： 一般用词，指从所在地到其它地方去，着重目的地而非出发地。
start ： 可与leave换用，强调目的地，但不及leave普通。
quit ： 侧重指离开令人烦恼的地方，或摆脱使人不快的人或事。
set out ： 书面用词。

sentence.Network_en: Well, parenthetically, I was trying to quit smoking at the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 嗯，插一句，我那时正在努力戒烟。

sentence.Network_en: He quit his job as an office boy in Athens.
sentence.Network_cn: 他辞去了在雅典当办公室勤杂工的工作。

sentence.Network_en: He did not quit as France's prime minister of his own accord.
sentence.Network_cn: 他辞去法国总理职务并非出于自愿。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (in the sense 'set free'): from Old French quiter (verb), quite (adjective), from Latin quietus, past participle of quiescere 'be still', from quies 'quiet'

entry.def: If you quit your job, you choose to leave it.

example.ex: He quit his job as an office boy in Athens...
example.tran: 他辞去了在雅典当办公室勤杂工的工作。

example.ex: He figured he would quit before Johnson fired him.
example.tran: 他估计自己会在约翰逊炒他鱿鱼之前先辞职。

entry.def: If you quit an activity or quit doing something, you stop doing it.

example.ex: A nicotine spray can help smokers quit the habit without putting on weight...
example.tran: 尼古丁喷雾剂能够帮助吸烟者在不增加体重的同时戒烟。

example.ex: I was trying to quit smoking at the time.

entry.def: If you quit a place, you leave it completely and do not go back to it.

example.ex: ...the idea that humans might one day quit the earth to colonise other planets...
example.tran: 人类有朝一日可能会离开地球到其他星球定居繁衍的想法

example.ex: Police were called when he refused to quit the building.
example.tran: 他拒绝离开那座大楼，于是人们叫来了警察。

entry.def: If you say that you are going to call it quits, you mean that you have decided to stop doing something or being involved in something.

example.ex: They raised $630,000 through listener donations, and then called it quits...
example.tran: 他们通过听众捐款的方式筹集了63万美元后宣告结束。

example.ex: You can decide whether there is hope in working for mutual happiness, or if you should call it quits.
example.tran: 你可以决定是否有希望为双方共同的幸福努力，或者就此一刀两断。

means.word_mean: 1. put an end to a state or an activity;
2. give up or retire from a position;

sentences.sentence: "The Secretary fo the Navy will leave office next month"
"The chairman resigned over the financial scandal"

means.word_mean: 5. give up in the face of defeat of lacking hope; admit defeat;

sentences.sentence: "In the second round, the challenger gave up"

He is thinking of quitting it

The man has decided to quit his computer class

sentences.en: If I don't get a pay rise I'll quit.
sentences.cn: 若不给加薪, 我就不干了。

sentences.en: I got my present job when I quit the army.
sentences.cn: 我退伍后得到了现在这份工作。

jushi.english: If I don't get a pay rise I'll quit.
jushi.chinese: 若不给我加薪,我就不干了。

jushi.english: He quit when he realized he could not win.
jushi.chinese: 他认识到他不能取胜就放弃了。
